reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful, absolutely glorious stay at the Royal Palms.
reviews.title: Loved the new refurbishment - RPalms

likes.liked: — The whole resort and use of the resort hotel amenities
likes.disliked: — Went we had to leave, because we wanted to stay another week.

reviews.title: Ask for a refurb'd room!! Luxurious units!
reviews.text: The newly refurbished units and the use of the Marriott World Center main hotel amenities, makes this our favorite.
Very close to Disney.
reviews.title: Refurbushed Unit

reviews.text: We booked directly with condo owners and got a great rate. We found it by going to google and typing in RPalms. Compared with AAAA and expedia, we got a better deal, the only thing is you have to book weekly, starting on either a Friday or Saturday or Sunday.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is in the middle of a renovation..(a badly needed one..)
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here is very accommodating. We arrived early and were given a room immediately. The check in process was very speedy. The 2 bedroom villas are huge and very clean. They can sleep 7 people. My only complaint with the room was that I thought the shower in the master bedroom was small. The toilet is also in the same room as the shower so if somebody is using the toilet, nobody can use the shower. So if you are traveling with a gang this can be an issue. There is another full bathroom and a smaller bedroom with a queen size bed and a chair that is a sleeper chair and can accommodate one more person or a child. This property is close to main roads and you can hear traffic and road noise from the room even with the windows closed. If this bothers you then I would suggest you go elsewhere. We asked for a quiet room when we checked in and were assured that we were overlooking the golf course and it was quiet. The view of the golf course is really nice but you can hear the traffic. Especially if you are sitting out on the balcony. If you do not like people above you then insist on a top floor. We were on the 2nd floor and had a family above us that had an obsession with being out on the balcony. We continually had to hear them slamming the sliding glass door, especially late at night. It is a short walk to the marriott hotel which is huge and is a convention center. There is also 2 other marriott vacation club properties within the royal palms complex. I would imagine that when there is alot going on at the convention center it can get pretty hectic here with traffic and chaos. There is also a shuttle from royal palms to bring you over to the marriott hotel. We walked over there and were not really impressed. I didn't think that the pool was very large for a hotel of that size. They have a large waterslide for the kids but it was closed for renovations. They have alot of restaurants but I didn't eat at any. The hotel is close to disney but you need a car to get there. I don't think the hotel provides a shuttle to disney world. This property has a market place and a small gym. The pool is small but adequate. There is no restaurant or bar onsite but they do sell wine in the lobby. If you do not like cats then do not stay here. There seems to be many stray cats on the premises and around the pool area. If you are traveling with a group and you need space then this is the place for you. The kitchen is huge. Full size washer and dryer and the 2 bedrooms and bathrooms are nice. I believe that this is one of the oldest marriott vacation club properties. The rooms have been redone. The property does have an older feel to it but I got a great room rate and I cannot complain about my stay.
reviews.title: Nice marriott vacation club property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week here wish it could have been longer.lovely property.Clean and spacious .The perks include free transport to the hotel so that you can use the many facilities of the hotel.There are numerous pools to use in the property but the main one attached to the hotel is full of interesting things for people of all ages
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at a marriott vacation club and i was very impressed. I had a two bedroom villa which was very spacious and came with two bedrooms and bathrooms, full kitchen with cooking and eating items, pull out couch, pull out chair, dinning room table, living room and a washer and dryer. It is located next to the marriott world center and had free parking and internet service and all sorts of activities. There is a shuttle that will take you to the world center. Room was very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: I stayed in May 2013. I stayed in one of the Villas. The Villa has two rooms. One with Jacuzzi and other a kids room. It has a kitchenette. The wifi is very poor. I stayed in one of the villas which is close to the Pool. If you are expecting to get some work done, i suggest to get a wifi dongle rather than relying on the hotel wifi. The hotel mgmt are very helpful. They have advised that a new cable is being laid out later this year and should fix this is issue.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but poor wifi

reviews.text: Once every two years we come to Orlando and stay in Royal Palms, its a tradition, i been coming to Orlando since i was 4 yrs old. And looking at pictures and from what memory can tell me this place is always changing. The last time we were visiting, 2013 spring break, i notice they remodeled the place.
reviews.title: A good place to enjoy Orlando

reviews.text: We recently stayed here (family of four with a seven year old and a 4 year old). Nice location and well maintained property. We had a 2 bedroom unit which worked out great. Nice screened in porch for morning coffee or evening wine, without bugs. Unit was clean and neat and we had no complaints. New TVs and appliances. Used the pool one day and it was nice, not over 5 feet for the kids. Leaving in the morning for Magic Kingdom and Epcot takes about 10 minutes and Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios about 15 (so long as you pay attention to the signs and do not make a wrong turn). Staff was very helpful. No real complaint - pleased with the property and location.
reviews.title: Very nice facility and close proximity to Disney

reviews.text: This is our second trip to the Marriott Royal Palms and once again we were very impressed with the Marriott's attention to detail. We have also stayed at the Imperial Palms in a three-bedroom unit on the same property and were equally satisfied with that condo. This time we were pleased to be the first occupants in a newly-renovated and tastefully decorated two-bedroom, two bathroom unit overlooking the golf course (small note later about grounds-keeping at 5:00 a.m. one morning). The resort is central to everything in Orlando including Disney, shopping, restaurants and entertainment and close to highways should you decide to visit the beaches on either the Atlantic or Gulf of Mexico or to the Kennedy Space Centre at Cape Canaveral which are a short drive away. The pool/hot tub area for the Royal Palms is located close to the main office area and overlooks the golf course. The facilities (pools, spas, many restaurants and shops) at the World Trade Centre are also available to guests of the condos at the Royal Palms, Imperial Palms and Sabal Palms, located on the property and a shuttle service is provided to ferry guests back and forth. A small tuck shop is located on site at the Royal Palms and although the prices are fairly high, a good selection of essentials and wines/alcohol and snacks is available. The only negative that we found was that the golf course grounds keepers awakened us at 5:00 a.m. the first morning to a barrage of leaf blowers, lawn mowers and lights attached to head gear since it was still pitch dark outside. I suspect that there were many complaints since it never happened again during our stay. All in all, we had a wonderful vacation and highly recommend this resort.
reviews.title: Well-run Resort in Excellent Location

reviews.text: Marriott provides a relaxing experience in a peaceful setting. This resort is more "homelike" than many. There are children's playgrounds,picnic tables, and pool toys provided for use, as well as shuffleboard, basketball, etc. The kitchen is large enough for 3 cooperating adults to work at once, and the round glass dining table is spacious. The balconies are open on 2 sides and look out on the golf course.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: One drawback is the second bedroom has one queen size bed and not a lot of extra floor space. The second bathroom is somewhat small but does have storage shelves behind the door that ease the crunch.
reviews.title: Sent maid early the last day of our stay... Respect please!

reviews.text: The staff is friendly, but activities are virtually non existent, primarily because there are few participants in this smaller resort.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has many ups and a one serious down to recommend it. We stayed using a time share the last full week of April and for that price it was a good overall stay. We had previously stayed at the Marriott's Cypress Harbor and were familiar with the properties. Our room was completely remodeled and had all the necessary requirements for an extended stay. The kitchen was fully equipped with all manner of appliances, pots and pans, and the like. The decor was modern and tasteful. Living room couch folds out into a bed and was predictably uncomfortable to sit on. The other chairs were pretty hard as well. We stayed in the master and the king size bed was fine. The master bath is integrated into the suite with a jacuzzi tub and double sink. The toilet and shower were behind a separate door. The second bath had handicap rails to access the tub and toilet with a detachable shower head. We were in room 4160, more on that later. There was plenty of hot water and the towels were very nice, and plentiful. The second bedroom has a queen and a pull out chair bed and is pretty cramped. All of the tvs were new LG flat screens with good reception and many channels.
reviews.title: Attention Interval time share members

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were very few facilities in the clubhouse area, but a shuttle is available to use the facilities at the main hotel. There is no bar or snack bar available. The pool is small, but clean etc. The property is small compared to the other Marriotts in Orlando, such as the Cypress. We requested a room on the top floor and could not be accommodated. We ended up on the second floor under a heard of elephants who seemed to clomp and scrape their way across the floor from 8am to 9pm each day. Not horrible noise, but very distracting. Definitely hold out for a top floor room!
reviews.title: Good, but not a resort

reviews.text: Finally, Orlando accommodations are all about location, location, location. Located on World Center Drive, it was a straight 4.5 mile shot to the Disney parks which makes it worth the while for a time share. The room can hold up to 7 relatively comfortably, It is completely upgraded and it's a breeze to get back to when you need a break from the park.
reviews.title: Wow what a place to stay at

reviews.text: If you are expecting the same type of resort as Grande Vista or Cypress harbor, you will be disappointed. We have stayed at Grande Vista five times, and there is no comparison to the full resort experience that awaits guests there. Cypress Harbor is close, but lags behind in the overall scope and grandeur.....Marriott's Royal Palms is similar in villas, and the amenities within, but is nothing like those resorts.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.text: Royal Palms is small....4 buildings, and one pool. Though it is all up to the Marriott Vacation Club standards, it pales in comparison to the flagship resorts marriott usually put out. There is no food or drink on premises....you must walk up to the hotel (Marriott World Center), and it's over 1/2 mile. This gets old fast....by day three, you want the real deal. Also, the pool is small (the sign says maximum occupancy is 44), whereas the pool at the World Center is one of the biggest I ever saw (and absolutely gorgeous). You end up walking there every day, and ignoring the pool at Royal Palms. Also, it can be a real pain not being able to get a drink or bite to eat while at the pool....more incentive to walk. Lastly, there are virtually none of the activities we have grown used to....barbecues, luau night, musicians, poolside bingo, exercise classes, etc. The hotel does not have any of these, either, so the experience is not the same (though the hotel is a city in itself, with many restaurants, shops, bars, pools, etc.). However, if what you seek is a roomy, clean, immaculate villa with full kitchen, lots of storage, living room, 3 TVs, laundry in your room, seperate bedrooms, quiet and gorgeous setting, and a small pool and clubhouse (which quite frankly is what most families that spend their days at Disney really want!), this is the place. It's right outside the Disney gate, and blows away any hotel room arrangement you can imagine. Just don't call it a true resort.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights in April 2013. Resort is in perfect location for Disney, Sea World, shopping and other attractions. Also close to several restaurants. I must admit that I am always nervous when staying at a new location; however, I was pleasantly surprised!! The villa was spacious, clean, and had all the amenities that we needed!!! I would definitely recommend this resort and I am looking forward to staying here again!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We had a 4-night stay during Spring Break. Very relaxing, helpful staff. Shopped for groceries on the way in and never really needed to leave the grounds. Sports courts area was popular with our teens, nice fitness center too, overlooking the pool deck.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Stayed for 7 days during spring. Resort is located right next to the World Marriott and the resort guests can access all the amenities of the World Marriott. There is a shuttle that runs whenever needed by the guests which is great. The resort is located on some very nice grounds, pretty much quiet and very clean. The unit is itself is very nice and very well kept. The staff goes out of their way to make sure that you are happy and that anything that is wrong is recified in an orderly fashion, in our case it was the A/C unit. What was a bit upsetting was that it took a bit long to check in as there was only one person working the desk when I arrived all tired, but that was only a minor thing. Over all a great property great experience, great staff. Great for families. Located a few minutes from Disney and the Premium outlets.
reviews.title: Very nice property

reviews.text: My family depends on me to make reservations and make the best decision based on everyone's need. I pride myself for the smiles I see on their face when they first turn the door and walk in the suite. We usually stick with what we know which is the Marriott's Grand Vista. This time I decided to step outside the box and try the Royal Palms. The Royal Palms superseded my expectations. Everything was new from the paint to the decor. Very elegant and the decor was on point. We enjoyed every minute in our 2 bedroom suite. We were so pleased with our suite that we wanted to skip the theme park and just relax in the suite. It felt like our home away from home. Hat's off to the Royal Palms. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Wow!!! Very pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at 15 Marriott Vacation Club facilities as owners over 12 years. This is an older property-perhaps 18 to 20 years old. Very well maintained with updated furnishings and flat screen HD tvs. Staff is very helpful and attentive. Probably under 250 units. Because of the size of the complex, there is a very small market place, no bar and no prepared food available on the property.
reviews.title: predictable Marriott- very well maintained

reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Palms for five nights beginning the day after Easter, apparently high season but we didn't experience much in the way of overwhelming crowds.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, nice

reviews.text: I had read the reviews and was sceptical about what to expect. My sister and I along with three kids 9,4 and 2 had more than enough room. Our room was spotless every day when we returned. The kids loved the jacuzzi in the master bedroom. The 9 year old was a boy with 2 girls but the second bedroom had a daybed that he thought was 'awesome'. He was able to put his stuff in the drawers and cabinets underneath the bed. The girls loved the screened in patio. My sister who is a senior loved the spaciousness and decor. It is so close to Disney and I-drive area. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

likes.liked: — lush greenery outside, screened in porch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from the Royal Palms and had a great time! I went with my fiance (we're 23) from May 26- June 2. We loved our room, it was very clean when we arrived and it even was ready early for us. The pool was pretty nice, but the one at the other hotel was awesome. The shuttle service was prompt and convenient, so it was no problem getting there. The only thing I didn't like was that our jacuzzi tub didn't work. We rented a car and I would highly recommend doing so because it allows you the freedom to do what you want, when you want. I would definitely go again!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The first two-bedroom villa they sent us to had not been cleaned - filthy counter tops, dirty cups in sink, trash can flipped over on the floor, the master bed didn't even have sheets on it. The next villa we were sent to did have sheets but the lack of cleanliness was similar. And both rooms smelled like smoke. My husband is a Marriott Rewards member and we have stayed at many extremely nice hotels in this chain but will never stay here again or recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Yuck
Love the Marriott Royal Palms
reviews.text: We visited the Marriott Royal Palms in March 06. We picked the locale since its in very close proximity to the Disney parks. My child was 3 at the time so she loved that idea.

reviews.title: Prom weeken
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and wonderful. There's plenty to do right on site. Since they had a shuttle running continously to the main hotel (Marriott's World Center), we just traveled back and forth to go to fabulous restaurants and visit the pool. (You have got to see the Marriott's pool. My best friend is still talking about it. I think we had more fun on the slide than the kids did.)
